message.content: This question can be answered by understanding how rivers and hills interact with each other. When a river is flowing down the east side of a hill, it means that the water is eroding the land on that side of the hill. This erosion causes the hill to drop sharply in that specific area. Option (A) is incorrect because if the hill dropped at a slow rate, the river would not have enough force to flow down the hill. Option (C) is incorrect because the river is eroding the land on the east side, not the west side. Option (D) is incorrect because the presence of a river indicates that there is a variation in slope.

When a river is flowing down the east side of a hill, it means that it is eroding the land on that side. As a result of erosion, the hill drops sharply on the east side where the river is flowing. Option (A) is incorrect because the rate of drop is not mentioned and cannot be determined from the given information. Option (C) is incorrect because the hill drops sharply on the side where the river is flowing, not on the opposite side. Option (D) is incorrect because the drop is not even everywhere, it is specifically on the east side of the hill.
